name: Habanero Deviled Eggs
title: Habanero Deviled Eggs
imageAltText: Deviled eggs on a plate with paprika
instructions: Hard boil the eggs. Cook in boiling water for 10 minutes and afterwards rest them in a colander.
Finely dice the onion, pepper and garlic (or crush the garlic).
Add the onions to a pre-heated saucepan with some cooking oil (e.g. olive, coconut oil).
After around 3-4 minutes (when the onion is soft), add the garlic and pepper. Cook for another 3 minutes or so.
Peel the eggs under cold running water. Transfer to a chopping board.
Carefully remove the yolks and put them in a small mixing bowl. Add the mustard, mayonnaise and onion/pepper/garlic mix. Optionally add a dash of worcestershire sauce.
Mix with a fork or spoon until the mixture becomes a mash (not fully smooth, some texture is good).
Spoon or pipe the mixture back into the egg whites.
Garnish the eggs with a very small amount of paprika - be careful not to put too much on, as it can have a gritty texture. Use a fine seive and only about 1/8th of a teaspoon of paprika. Enjoy!
